feed.title: The Developers‚Äô Bakery
feed.subtitle: A podcast about Developer Tools and productivity, freshly baked to you by Nicola Corti.

entry.title: #91 - Excalidraw with Aakansha Doshi
entry.content:
Today we‚Äôre going to talk about Excalidraw üé®, a web tool to sketch diagrams with a hand-drawn style.

I‚Äôm glad to have on stage Aakansha Doshi, one of the maintainer of Excalidraw, to tell us more about this project. Aakansha will tell us the story of Excalidraw, how it evolved over time, and its secret to achieve the distinctive hand-drawn style.

We‚Äôll also talk about the community around Excalidraw, and Aakansha will share some tips on how to start contributing to your first open-source project.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥

entry.title: #90 - Chucker with Nicola Corti
entry.content:
It‚Äôs time for another special episode, 90!

Together with our own Nicola, we‚Äôre diving into the world of Chucker, an open-source library that helps you debug network requests in Android.

With Chucker you can simply inspect the HTTP and GraphQL requests and responses, visualize the body such as JSON or images, and even export them to share with your team.

Nicola will tell us the story of how this library was born, how it evolved over time, and how you can use it in your projects.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥

Show Notes

  • 00.00 Intro
  • 00.46 Episode Start
  • 01.38 What is Chucker?
  • 04.13 Installing Chucker
  • 06.51 Chucker features
  • 13.44 v4
  • 17.03 Crash reporting?
  • 19.51 Configuring Chucker
  • 22.34 From Chuck to Chucker

  • 34.14 Supporting Chucker

entry.title: #89 - Language Servers with Gorkem Ercan
entry.content:
We‚Äôre back with another episode about developer tooling and this time we‚Äôre diving into the world of Language Servers!

We have the pleasure to have on stage Gorkem Ercan, the CTO of Jozu and member of the Eclipse Foundation Board. Gorkem will walk us through his journey in the world of Language Servers, from writing Visual Studio Code plugins to building both the Java and the YAML Language Server.

We‚Äôll also talk a lot about Eclipse IDE, the Eclipse Foundation, and we‚Äôll touch also on his new project: Kitops.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥

entry.title: #88 - Charty with Himanshu Singh
entry.content:
It‚Äôs time to spotlight another amazing Android library in this episode of The Developers‚Äô Bakery! Today, I‚Äôm joined by Himanshu Singh, author and maintainer of Charty.

Charty is a chart library entirely written for Jetpack Compose. In this episode, Himanshu will walk us through the complexities of building custom UI libraries and his passion for open-source.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥

entry.title: #87 - Redpanda with Christina Lin
entry.content:
We keep on exploring the world of data with another amazing guest: Christina Lin, Developer Advocate at RedPanda.

RedPanda is a data streaming platform, entirely built with C++ that aims to be faster and more efficient than Kafka. In this episode, Christina tells us all about RedPanda, its features, and how it‚Äôs different from other streaming platforms.

Christina also shares her journey into Developer Advocacy, and share some of her tips to create engaging content for developers.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥

entry.title: #86 - Dagster with Sandy Ryza
entry.content:
Today is time to talk about Data Pipelines and Data Engineering. I‚Äôm really excited to have on stage Sandy Ryza, Lead Engineer of Dagster.

If you‚Äôre a software engineer and you‚Äôre afraid of dealing with data pipelines, fear no more! Sandy is on a mission to make data pipelines easier to handle for software engineers. Join us in this episode to learn more about Dagster, and how it can make it easier for you to build and manage your data assets.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥

entry.title: #85 - Kotlin Multiplatform at Google I/O with Marcello Galhardo

link.title: #85 - Kotlin Multiplatform at Google I/O with Marcello Galhardo

entry.content:
Welcome to a special in-person episode of The Developers‚Äô Bakery, recorded live in Berlin at Google I/O Connect 2024!

There, I had the privilege of having on stage Marcello Galhardo, Software Engineer at Google. Marcello is working in the AndroidX team responsible for adding Kotlin Multiplatform support for several popular AndroidX libraries.

If you‚Äôre an Android Developer, you probably used one of those libraries in your projects, such as Lifecycle or Room. Marcello is going to walk us through the latest announcements about Kotlin Multiplatform at Google I/O, and how they‚Äôre going to impact the way we build Android apps.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥

Show Notes

  • 00.00 Intro
  • 00.50 Episode Start

entry.title: #84 - System Initiative with Adam Jacob
entry.content:
Today we talk about a completely new topic: DevOps and System configuration. I‚Äôm really excited to have on stage Adam Jacob, CEO and Co-founder of System Initiative.

Adam is challenging the status quo of DevOps tools with a completely new approach to system configuration. While System initiative looks like a no-code tool at first, it comes with all the power of TypeScript to let you build and manage your infrastructure in a completely new way.

We will talk about the history of System Initiative, the challenges of building a new tool in a crowded space, and the future of DevOps.

Adam is also the co-founder of Chef, a really popular configuration management tool, and he will share with us some of the lessons learned from that previous experience.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥

  • 00.00 Intro
  • 00.46 Episode Start

entry.title: #83 - Hasura with Tanmai Gopal
entry.content:
Hi everyone, today is time to talk about GraphQL! We have on stage Tanmai Gopal, CEO and co-founder of Hasura.

Hasura is an open-source GraphQL engine that helps you build and scale your GraphQL APIs, basically ‚Äòwithout‚Äô limits! We‚Äôll talk about the history of Hasura, how it works, and what‚Äôs next for this project. Join us in this episode as Tanmai will tell us his story founding Hasura and how they‚Äôre building a vibrant ecosystem around this project.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥

entry.title: #82 - Mautic with Ruth Cheesley
entry.content:
Time for a brand-new topic today, as we‚Äôre going to talk about Marketing Automation.

I‚Äôm excited to have on stage Ruth Cheesley, who‚Äôs going to tell us all about Mautic. Mautic is a marketing automation software, that helps you manage your email campaigns, track your user engagement, and much more. It‚Äôs fully open-source (written in PHP üêò) and works either as self-hosted or as a cloud solution.

But we‚Äôre also going to talk about another crucial topic in open-source: governance models. Ruth has been supporting the Mautic community for years, and helped them navigate through a governance model change. She‚Äôs going to share what worked and what not for Mautic and give us some tips on how to manage a community project.

Enjoy the show üë®‚Äçüç≥
